trans-unit.source: The following steps help you use Azure CLI easily with the most recent version and the proper subscription.
trans-unit.target: The following steps help you use Azure CLI easily with the most recent version and the proper subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you need to install Azure CLI and connect it to your account first, see the <linkText>Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you need to install Azure CLI and connect it to your account first, see the <linkText>Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To use Azure CLI for imperative commands with service management mode, you should have a recent version if possible.
trans-unit.target: To use Azure CLI for imperative commands with service management mode, you should have a recent version if possible.

trans-unit.source: If you want to update your version of Azure CLI, see <linkText>Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to update your version of Azure CLI, see <linkText>Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Once you have connected your Azure CLI with the account you want to use, you may have more than one subscription. If you do, you should review the subscriptions available for your account by typing azure account list, and then select the subscription you want to use by typing azure account set true where subscription id or name is either the subscription id or the subscription name that you would like to work with in the current session. You should see something like the following:
trans-unit.target: Once you have connected your Azure CLI with the account you want to use, you may have more than one subscription. If you do, you should review the subscriptions available for your account by typing azure account list, and then select the subscription you want to use by typing azure account set true where subscription id or name is either the subscription id or the subscription name that you would like to work with in the current session. You should see something like the following:

trans-unit.source: If you don't already have an Azure account but you do have a subscription to MSDN subscription, you can get free Azure credits by activating your <linkText>MSDN subscriber benefits here</linkText><title></title> -- or you can use the free account.
trans-unit.target: If you don't already have an Azure account but you do have a subscription to MSDN subscription, you can get free Azure credits by activating your <linkText>MSDN subscriber benefits here</linkText><title></title> -- or you can use the free account.

trans-unit.source: Either will work for Azure access.
trans-unit.target: Either will work for Azure access.
